text: When you start feeling yourself while listening, do you rip your shirt off?
What the!
So we have very special guests joining us today
Jay Park
Yes
and DJ Wegun
Could you introduce yourselves?
Ok. I'm Jay Park
Hello, I'm DJ Wegun
So like
this guy should
He needs an intro?
Of course, most hip hop fans probably know who he is already but
your everyday viewers might not be interested in hip hop so...
You're right, you're right
So DJ Wegun is a producer, DJ who is signed with AOMG as an artist
We recently released an album together and ended up on your show today
[Everybody Sucks]!
Correct
[Everybody Sucks]!
What it means is
Everybody, including ourselves, have weaknesses or flaws right?
We do
We all have a beautiful side, but on the contrary
we also have parts that just sucks
I have so many
Yeah, so that's what the title means
Aren't you known as a veteran hip hop DJ within the DJ scene in Korea?
Yeah, I've been in the game for a while
How long have you been DJing?
I think about 19 years
By 19 years you mean
Since I was 16
So you started making money at age of 16?
Ah, no I didn't
So you think my question was stupid?
Everybody Sucks!
He was speaking with his eyes just now!
Sucker!
No, it's not that
There's no way for a DJ just getting started to make money right off the bat
Oh really?
Of course
He just started producing music
So how did your work on your music back then?
I just practiced a lot
with turntables and other DJ equipment
How did you get those DJ equipment?
My mother bought it for me
Your mother bought it for you?
That's the best. Mother knows best
Mothers always pick the cheapest one with the best quality
Mothers usually don't buy you that kind of stuff
Yeah there's no way. Never
How did you get her to buy you one?
I refused to eat, and threw a tantrum
Wow, usually
Don't you have to prove yourself usually?
Yeah like with exams
Usually, you have to prove that you can still focus on your studies, and ace an exam or something
But you threw a tantrum
That was honest
But back then
Nowadays hip hop and DJing became popular that people consider it as a career
but back in the day
you couldn't even imagine it
Yeah
Parents would not have approved of being a DJ, rapper, or a dancer
So how, through what process can you become a DJ?
You can't just become a DJ once you buy the equipment
So I just started with listening to a lot of hip hop music
then I watched a lot of videos and practiced by myself
So you practiced and just got better?
How did you do it?
He's asking how did you make a career out of what you started as a hobby?
Wow, he's so good at Korean
He's good at grasping the main point
I started making money around 23
I started making money for the first time after I joined a label called 'Soul Company'
I made close to nothing before that
I'm curious about how you joined Soul Company?
So I was alone
They're responding well to Soul Company!
They know what it is
They are saying that it's OG
When I was around 16,17, I bought a camcorder
and started uploading videos of me DJing on hip hop communities online
I even made a website and then people started to recognize
They were like he's good
I started featuring on Soul Company's music and naturally
They recognized your talent and asked you to join
Something like that
Do people tell you that you suck?
There are so many.
What, really?
As in musically?
Whether it be music or
People also tell you that you suck
I have too many to count
He even won a grand prize for his web cartoon
and there were some people that were like 'you call that a cartoon?'
Hey, it wasn't that harsh
The comments were not that extreme
They were like 'THAT is a cartoon?'
I don't remember that though
Are you sure that you didn't write it?
No, it wasn't me
I don't know how to use the internet
Yeah, it wasn't that bad
Anyway, that's how the internet reacted when he won the grand prize as a webcartoonist
It's hard to avoid hate, no matter how good you are
That's true
You can anonymously say whatever you want on the internet
and some people find it entertaining
Like, some people just say things even when they don't mean it for the fun of it
So, I've tried it once
Did you write hate comments before?
To myself, or to artists from my label as a joke which they can tell that it's me though
Aha, as a joke that people can tell it's you?
But it was kind of fun, I was like 'oh this is why they do it!'
I've also been doing that recently
Both of you are aspiring haters
Yeah, I comment on other streamers live broadcasts
Right?
With no context at all, you just type 'sucker' or stuff like that
It works as a stress reliever
Yeah, when you don't have to filter your thoughts, it relieves stress
Especially when it's for no reason at all
Sucker is lowkey a hate comment though
Wait, it's high key a hate comment
It's for real
I make sure that it's not rooted in anything so that it's obviously a joke
So do you write comments on YouTube or?
Yeah YouTube or Instagram
Then do you have a favorite YouTube channel?
'Calm Down Man' of course
I do watch a lot of your channel
He's Korean so
Yeah, he is
For me, I watch a lot of martial arts videos
Oh?
'StungunTV' channel?
Yeah we know him
Korean Zombie's channel and this guy named 'Seungwoo Appa'
Oh Seungwoo Appa?
And like the 'RiceCookingGuy'
You watch his channel?
Like food-related channels
So that's what you like
It's mostly about eating or working out
I used to watch a lot of rap/hip hop channels
but like you've said I also lost my passion for it that
I began watching things that aren't hip hop-related more.
And then you leave hate comments there
No, I don't do that on those channels
On you don't?
I only do it to my close friends
I see
To make it obvious
So that it obviously looks like Jay Park doing it
With my ID
On purpose, as a joke
Things like 'you rang?' or stuff like that
Something like 'this sucks' or
'ew, stop pretending to be good looking'
I have a question related to DJing
So you scratch the vinyl back and forth while DJing
Yeah
That's how they used to DJ but I heard people don't do that anymore
But I heard that you still use vinyl when you DJ
Yeah, I still use turntables to DJ
Back in the day, I used real vinyl
I heard that most DJs nowadays use laptops that look like this
Yeah, they do
It's called a digital vinyl
To simply put it, it allows you to transfer songs from your laptop to the vinyl
With such technology, I think people have grown to prefer digital vinyl
But of course, people still use real vinyl as well
Do you know what digital vinyl is?
Yeah, digital vinyl!
It's a bit smaller, right?
No, it's the same size
You don't know as well?
I asked because I didn't know
How could you?
'It looks just like a real vinyl!
Both of you were like 'ahh' as if you knew something
so I just thought, 'do they know?'
This! Of course I know!
I know it! You go like this!
It doesn't have indents
Yeah, THAT!
Yeah it carries frequency data
Knew it
To put it simply
It's like a tablet computer. Tablets also come with a pen
Did you know this?
Do you know what a tablet is?
No, I had no idea
Both of you were like 'ahhh, yes, that'
and I was like 'I have no idea what's going on, do they know?'
I had no idea at all
No need to try to understand
Okay
We don't know as well
Jay doesn't know that much either
Yeah, I'm always confused
When I see DJ Wegun playing music, I think 'oh he's playing music' and that's it
There aren't that many DJs that use digital vinyl?
No, there are so many now
But a lot of people prefer to use CD-based DJ deck than turntables
It's more simple
And I have one more thing to tell you
Our
Our album?
We are planning to release a vinyl version
In early December
People nowadays make a vinyl version just to
Seem trendy
That too, and people buy it just to collect them
as a keepsake
Vinyl is more popular than CDs now
Vinyl is called LP
It's similar to how
we still print books when everything is available to read on the internet now
It's become a collectible
That's why printed books don't sell well
They read it online instead
You're right
Through pay per view platforms
That's true
He cashed out millions from it
Stop talking nonsense!
But he pretends to be broke!
It's all for show
You need to give back to the local communities you know?
You always tell me to give back, why don't you lead by example then?
Lead by example
I have another question for you
Just out of my curiosity, do you have times where you just don't want to DJ?
Yeah, I do
For example, when I'm DJing at a party
there times where I'm not feeling the mood of the party
Once in a while
Or there's like no crowd
That could be one too
Could you give us an example of the situation?
The crowd is not enjoying it
Yeah, something like that
These people are gonna be here whether I'm DJing or not
and it makes you question 'why am I here?'
When the crowd is too chatty, or when it looks too empty
Or like
you guys might not know this but
it's rude to give song requests to DJs
You're not supposed to make song requests?
You can't ask DJs to play a certain song?
It depends on the DJ but
if it's a DJ that plays at a club or a party, they might think it's rude
Do you know why started making song requests?

It's because DJs always ask for song requests 
(*he means DJs back in the day in Korea)
So people just assume that club DJs would also take song requests too
Since they're both DJs
'Can you play this song?'
Ah, since they're both DJs
But DJs like me spend a very long time preparing for that 1-hour set
Research
I think about how I'm going to start and
You would plan out your set
Then people come to the DJ booth and make requests
That's not okay because you had it all planned already
So when I play their song, it ruins my whole plan that I had set up
Especially when the crowd is not in the mood for it
then I don't want to play music in situations like that
Like, in a 1-hour set
each song may not seem like one but

they are all tied together like 'one giant boat'
(*war strategy term from The Three Kingdoms)
so when you are forced to add another boat
It's a Chinese full course meal and
You simply can't add on
you're adding Korean Pork Feet to the menu
That actually sounds good right now
What would you do if someone came over and got on their knees
to beg you to play a song for them?
On their knees and say 'I can die in peace if you play this song for me'
I have never seen anyone like that
but if there were one, then I would take their song request
You would force it on to your playlist
It's usually the drunk people
They're feeling the alcohol, in a good mood
and they want to listen to the song of their choice
They usually bring me a shot and ask for it
I consider it when they're being nice about it
What if they take out $30
and they hand it to you
And say 'can you play this song?'
I think I would get offended
For $30, I'll just do my thing
So you just take the $30?
Dine and dash
And you're not going to play?
Perhaps?
He would give it back!
The drunk guy is not going to leave otherwise
Or you can just play it for like 5 seconds then
Yeah, I can play it for 10 seconds then switch it back
This is a good idea for Twitch
You can DJ and be like 'taking requests now!'
Oh, yeah
Yeah you can take song requests online since you can't in real life
There's a lot of DJ channels on Twitch
I do it once in a while as well
Do you take song requests?
No, I play whatever I want
Have you done it recently?
I haven't in a while
I asked people about what I should ask
and a lot of people were asking me to tell Jay Park not to retire
What do they mean? Are you going to retire?
By retiring, I mean I want to take a pause on music and being a celebrity
Taking a break from going on shows, filming something
featuring for other people, releasing an album
I want to take a step back
and focus my efforts on things that I need to get done
That was a very wishy-washy answer
What can you do from the back?
Like operations and management
Run a company?
I've got my own
how should I put it?
I'm experienced in a wide range of things
I started two companies and helped a lot of artists become successful
which means that I have my 'know-how's and 'how-to's
and I want to share that
Are you sick of making music?
With making music
it's not the most entertaining thing for me
It's not the same
Exactly
Then why do you make music?
Are you forcing yourself?
Though it's not as fun as before, I do enjoy making music as of now
But anyhow
The two of you are very similar
What?
The only difference is web cartoon and music
The subject is different but you guys are in a similar situation
No way!
He has like 50 employees
I was talking to someone from your company before we started
so you try your best to do your part in running the company
Yeah, do the things that I have to do
For example, they want me on this show and feature on this song, then ok
If I feel the need for a change in certain things then I get into the business of it
I try to let it be, if I don't feel the need to
I always wondered how is was possible that you run a company with 50 employees
while producing music and all?
It's hard. That's why I want to rest
I thought you were a Superman
as in never tired
I'm not
But you're not
He is not Superman, he is Jay Park
Jay Park is also a human like us
I see
I love it. I love that. That’s my thing
I’ll ask another one from here
Did you say that you’re going to make soju?
Yes
You mean you’re going to make liquor?
You’re right
Like a brand?
Yes, yes
How?
How I came up with the idea is that
After I signed with Roc Nation, Jay-Z's label
the first single I released was called ‘SOJU’
I went to promotions like radio stations
but most people didn’t know what soju was
maybe because they’re mostly non-Asians
So I tried to let them know what soju was
and they asked me ‘do you have your own soju?’
since most rappers there have their own liquor brands
They were asking if you have a soju brand that’s on sale
It was a shame that many people got to know soju through me
but I didn't have my own brand
Did it hurt your pride?
No, but it was a shame
You must've been pissed off
No, I wasn’t
You were
Everyone had one so you were pissed off that you didn't, right?
I was motivated by it
Like ah!
Right, no one had done it before so I thought I gotta do it
I always like being the first person to do something
Even though it’s been a huge challenge, but
Has it launched yet?
Not yet
In the process of making it?
Yes, it’s taking longer than I thought
There’re many kinds of house beers out there
but I’ve never heard of house soju before
There’s no house distilled liquor
When will it be launched?
We’re having many meetings right now
about techniques and whom to work with like factories and stuff
I have one tomorrow about this
You’re really busy
I have meetings every week
Do you have a brand name in your mind?
‘Won Soju’
Why ‘Won Soju’?
There’s a lot of meaning to it
The word ‘Won’ in both Korean and English has good meanings
Yes, it is
It could represent a shape, Korean currency, 1st place, victory, and so on
The name is full of good meanings
Let’s make him one. It’s a bit boring
Like ‘Won Soju’?
You are a creator
‘Destroyer ju’

‘Next week ju’
(*ju means 'week' and also 'liquor' in Korean)
I like the name, ‘Next week ju’
It promises that there will be the next time, as you drink
For the future
For the future, ‘Next week ju’!
Cheers!
There’s a description that always tags along with your name
You mean ‘nipple party’?
No, I didn’t mean to say ‘nipple party’
I meant ‘shirtless’ since you take off your shirt while performing often
When did you start taking your shirt off?
When I was young, you know like Usher
Do you know Usher?
I know him, 'You Make Me Wanna'
Usher…?
Anyway, I grew up watching R&B artists
who tended to be sexy with dance moves and were shirtless
So I naturally thought that I have to be like them too
I worked out to get the R&B and pop singer abs and be shirtless on stage
It’d be nice to have one
So I’ve been doing this since then
So you’ve been preparing to get shirtless in order to become an artist?
No, it’s not like that
Isn’t it correct?
Yes, the context is correct
It’s similar
But well, I don’t know
I thought of being shirtless after becoming an artist,
I didn’t go shirtless to become an artist.
You didn't
You definitely didn’t become an artist to be shirtless
Of course!
I took off my shirt because I’ve become an artist
That's right.
You wanted to become an artist and artists at that time boasted their sexy bodies
Yes, for R&B artists
Songs were about love and artists danced on stage
Even if you don’t have to now, you have grown a habit of working out because of the time you've put in building a body?
I just love to work out like sweating and moving
I can’t stay still
so I love working out
I got a question
When you take your shirt off
do you have specific timings in your mind before going on stage
or do you take it off randomly on stage when you’re in the zone?
He definitely has one
There are timings of course!
Oh there are?
People will go crazy if I take if off now?
There’re several timings lined up and
if pass one then you wait for the next one
You time is so that when the beat drops BOOM, then you go like KAW
No ripping though
Ripping is kind of old-fashioned
What do you do nowadays then?
It won’t be easily ripped
So do you take it off then fold it neatly on the side?
Nowadays I cut it with scissors
Oh with scissors
Just kidding
I just take it off
Who on earth would cut it with scissors?
It was a joke, but I completely fell for it and was just like 'ahh'
He was like that when we were talking about digital vinyl
Stop pretending as if you know it
Did you think that I would go like ‘mommommommae’
and then keep singing?
Take it off and fold it neatly
He hasn’t been able to sleep since 3AM this morning
because he was looking forward this live so much
Oh you did?
Not really
Look at his eyes, they’re red
You look like you didn’t get enough sleep
Were you excited to be on the show with us? Were you?
I was, but not just because of that
We just released this album and planned for promotions, right?
So we were talking about promotions and the one and only content he said was Calm Down Man
You seem embarrassed
It’s true though
I wasn’t sure how appearing on Calm Down Man would help our album promotion
I wasn’t sure if it’d be effective?
It might even be a bad influence
But, he was very firm that he wanted to be on this show
so I thought it’d be fun
I feel like he made the album just to be on this show
So I guess you’re dragged by him
Me?
You’re dragged into it
but it’s fun in its own way
Yeah it's fun
I didn’t get dragged
but I didn’t really know what it was
You guys came all the way here
but all of our questions are dumb
It’s fine
I like it
We already had many interviews talking about serious things
so we’re open to random questions today
Then can I ask you one?
Sure
What was your first impression of each other?
We first met around 2015, 2016 at a concert greenroom
He was a celebrity at that time
not a Hip-hop artist
He was just getting started as a rapper
That's when we first met
So were you wary?
I wasn’t wary
because I thought he’s just different from me
From my perspective
though I had switched from being an Idol, I believed that I've been Hip-hop from the beginning
because my skills were rooted in B-boy and rap and that’s why I was able to debut as an Idol group anyway
But for the others, they could've thought
‘why is this Idol trying to rap?’ because I didn’t have much work to show and didn't approve.
I completely understand it
They were confused too
They were asking 'why?', perhaps?
Yes, I understand
but he
I didn’t think of you like that in the beginning
I'm not talking about you
Could it be victim mentality?
It could be
The public opinion was like that at that time
To be honest, I had no opinion of him
You didn’t think much of him?
All I thought was that he has a small face
He does
You have such clear skin and a babyface
Thank you
How?
Why are you looking me as if it’s unfair?
Why is your face so small?
This is why you have to work out
I eat a lot of things that are good for health
First of all, ginger tea
I drink a lot of ginger tea
I would never drink ginger tea
Finely chop garlics and drink them as a shot with a lemon and manuka honey
Manuka honey
I take it as a shot and I also drink beet juice
I need to keep my health on check
because I need to work out, drink and work
I took more than 60 flights last year
during my world tour
60 times
If I don’t take care of my health, I would faint
They’re saying ‘drop the beet (*but they pronounced as ‘beat’)’
Hahahaha
Drop the beet (beat)!
When I first met DJ Wegun,
he was very emotionless and quiet
He’s the type to quietly does his job and stay calm
So he’s the Calm Down Man of DJs
Yes, I think so
I don’t get excited that easily
So I wasn’t thinking that much
I was like ‘is he DJ Wegun from Soul Company?’
I wasn’t like 'I’m going to start Hip-hop now that I met Dok2 and The Quiett‘
In my mind, I’ve always been Hip-hop
So I wasn’t trying to get recognized from those people or anything
It took a long time but
I slowly became close with the industry people
I just did my thing and hoped that people would recognize me for my music someday
I’ve become close to people organically and naturally, they started to recognize me
None of it was forced
And AOMG has grown as a Hip-hop label
and people who’re interested in music wanted to know how to sign with AOMG
This is a question for both of you
What do you look for in an artist?
First of all, they have to be dope
What do you mean by ‘dope’?
Whether it’s rap or producing, having the basic skills are important
And maybe, personality?
How do you determine one’s personality?
I think Jay cares about personality
Frankly speaking, everyone has different standards for ‘dope’
Him and I’ve been devoting all out hearts to this industry for a long time
for over a decade
So we can tell that what their purpose is by their social media posts and also their music
What their state of mind is like and things like that
Are they only interested in the superficial things
or do they have a specific things that they’re into
You can tell
You have to manage your social media properly then
You shouldn’t upload anything unnecessary
The number of followers doesn’t matter
But I take a close look at their postings, and captions
because those clearly show who they are
their mindset and attitude towards hip hop, etc
I guess it’s kind of their resumes or portfolios
It could work like that
I try to analyze them
There’re so many talented people out there
but it’s important to differentiate between people that do it as a hobby
from the people that can pursue it as a career
There’re not many people who can pursue this as a career
I’m curious that if one wants to sign up
Sign up??
To AOMG?
Sign up
You can’t say sign up?
Signing up is more like you go on the website and type in your info, but this is different
You say that you want to join it
Let’s say there’s someone that wants to join the company
Then, do you check one’s Instagram account?
No, they’ll check it secretly
Ok, let’s say you check an account secretly
And you find nothing
There’re only postings about one’s private life, so you’re disappointed
Then you see the comment section and the person is in a heated discussion with other users
Like 'you call yourself an artist' blah blah blah
You find out that this person is really good at keyboard battles
to the point that one would become a good lyricist
Are you serious?
I’d hire as an employee who takes control of social media
Having potential is good, but you need to have the will to make things happen
If you don’t have the will then nothing matters
So you’re not interested in discovering and developing?
You need to have the will and the skills as well
In that case, it works differently
They suggest concepts and stuff
They ask like ‘are you interested in doing this?’
So you don't start with your own efforts
If you have the talent, company lets you know and develops it
But, in this case, you have to get ready by your will
One should solidify their musical color and our job is to develop and support
We don’t want to get a person with nothing just to make a celebrity
So if they send you portfolios, do you listen to them?
There were lots of questions like that
We get things like SoundCloud links or
demos from people around me
Some people would come and wait in front of the company
When I was at a bar in Atlanta, 3-4 guys came towards me
So I thought that they were trying to start something with me
But, they said hi and asked if they could rap for me
All of a sudden on the street?
While I was drinking
I ended up saying ok and listened
So did you tell them ‘you’re out’?
No I didn't
Gave them a necklace for pass
I love that kid of ambition and passion
but I think one should prove oneself as an artist first
We can talk after that
Anyone can rap
There’re even rap classes
There are so many
Does proving oneself mean that
It means you have to be dope
You have to be dope
Not just rap skills, but in terms of personal branding as well
I want to see that this person is making efforts to really make it
I want to see the will power
Do you know an artist called ‘Noise Master’?
Noise Master
Ah… it’s him?
Yeah, it’s his rap name
Oh really?
No no, but my social ID is Noise Master
Uh, I have a question for you. Have you released a song as well?
Show them some of your songs
Do you have it?
Show them
I don’t have any
You don't?
He made that name for himself when he was in middle school
No, made it when I was in high school because I wanted to be a DJ too
Oh really?
Yes, I wanted to become a Battle DJ
like ‘DJ Wreckx’ and ‘DJ soulscape’
I also started DJing because of DJ Wreckx
I was also a member of Blex in HiTel
at that time I tried to start DJing
But my mom told me to focus on school, so she didn’t buy me a turntable
That was the turning point
That changed everything
Yeah our lives diverged from that point
If his mom bought the turntable for him
you guys could’ve been sitting in different seats
Agreed
Maybe I could’ve been the Noise Master
He would’ve been The Great DJ Wegun, but she didn’t buy it for him
That’s why you named yourself Noise Master
because of the scratch noise
He wanted to do it but
Yeah I did it verbally
You can do it verbally, too
Can you beatbox?
I’m not good at beatboxing but, I used to like ‘Rahzel’
Who is Rhazel?
There’s this legendary beatboxer
He was a pioneer of beatbox who made beatbox famous worldwide
‘Mr.OK’ (*Korean Comedian) is also good at beatbox
He raps while he beatboxes
He raps on top of his own beatbox
How?
Like this
How can he make a beat sound on the top of beatbox?
That’s why he is the best
He makes a sound between sounds
When he does beatbox, he makes sound over here too
while making the sound with his voice at the same time
Then he moves a mic over here
Like Mr.OK
No, it’s like a filter, self filter
JinKiMyongKi (*Amazing Feats) Right?
What is JinKiMyoungKi?
An amazing skill
Amazing? Oh yes, he is so amazing
Uri Geller
What?
Like Uri Geller
You don’t know Uri Geller?
Fantastic, amazing
Magician
Spoon
Ohh this is Uri Geller
Nah not this, he doesn’t get it.
This skill isn’t called Uri Geller. Uri Geller is
Then Uri Geller
What is this lol
This is so distracting
Show us once more
Why did you bring him up all of a sudden?
That was cute. Wow, how did he do it?
This?
So next question!
Yeah!
You were a SNL crew before
Then you must like making people laugh
He loves it, did you see him just now?
Instead of making people laugh
Ah I’m sorry
Everyone has their own stories and reasons to stress about
So I joke around a lot with people around me and try to laugh more
because 'if you can’t avoid it, why don’t we enjoy the process?'
With SNL, I was born and raised in the U.S. and SNL for me was
